headline: Psalm of Return
description: A quiet confession of reorientation â€” the act of rising after disarray. Aleksandr faces his own restless mind and familiar hungers, but chooses motion, nourishment, and recommitment. Each breath becomes both prayer and step: a rhythm of renewal grounded in humility rather than triumph.
author: Aleksandr Agnitio
whyItMatters: Because healing is not a single act but a rhythm of returns. This psalm names the quiet courage of reorientation â€” to face oneâ€™s hungers without shame, to move again, to paint oneâ€™s own scatteredness into color. It honors persistence without grandeur: the holiness of trying again.

articleExcerpt: Not because I am strong, but because I refuse to stay fallen. The light that found me once still waits by the door. Each breath is a step toward it.

sourceFragments.title: Psalm of Return
sourceFragments.excerpt: I am scattered tonight. The old hungers circle: sugar, smoke, flesh, sleep withheld. My mind is loud and my hands restless. I have broken rhythm, blurred the line, and yetâ€” I face. I move. I nourish. I rest. I recommit.
